categories.category: University of California, Los Angeles alumni
University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign alumni
Naturalized citizens of the United States
Iraqi naturalized citizens of the United States

scholar.bdy:
Jack C. Hayya is professor emeritus of management science at the
Pennsylvania State University .
Education
B.S., Civil Enginering, University of Illinois at Champaign-Urbana, 1952
M.S., Management,
California State University, Northridge , 19611
Ph.D., Business Administration,
University of California, Los Angeles
, 196623
Personal
Jacob Hayya was born in
Iraq , about 1929.
In 19474, the government of
Iraq sent him to study engineering in the
United States
. During his undergraduate years he lived in the Cosmopolitan fraternity house at the
University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign , mostly with other foreign students.4 He was an engineer on some large public works projects before returning to academia.
He lives in
State College, Pennsylvania with his wife, Susan Hayya.
References
Hayya, Jack C. 1966. A study on the appropriate use of PERT in procurement contracts. Thesis (Ph. D.)--University of California, Los Angeles, 1966. OCLC 18820012
Hayya, Jack C. 1961. An analysis and evaluation of the United States and Soviet defense organizations. Thesis (M.S.)--San Fernando Valley State College, 1961. OCLC 9589374
" Bio of Jack Hayya". Penn State - Smeal College of Business. Retrieved on 2008-07-15. "Jack C. Hayya is Professor emeritus (since 1 July 1998) of Management Science at Penn State University and winner of that university's 1996 Graduate Faculty Teaching Award. He is a Fellow of Decision Sciences Institute (since 1990), was chair of its Publications Committee (1991-92); and vice-resident at-large (1992-94)."
Hayya, Jack (May 2005). "[https://netfiles.uiuc.edu/ro/www/CosmopolitanClubattheUniversityofIllinois/connections/nlspr05/nlspr05d.html Reminiscences of the Cosmo House]". Cosmo Connections. University of Illinois (Champaign-Urbana). Retrieved on 2008-07-15. "I came to the Cosmopolitan Fraternity"
Faculty homepage
